title: 104_hr1024
content: The text amends various sections of different titles by replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with different committees or entities such as the "Committee on Rules and Administration of the House of Representatives" and the "Public Printer". The Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in various sections of different titles, including Title 28, Title 40, and Title 44. The Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in Title 44, United States Code, including sections 305(a) and 309(a). The Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 amends various sections of Title 44, United States Code, replacing references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer." This includes amendments to sections 309(a), 312, 502, 504, 505, and 508. Section 508 of Title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives." Section 509 is also amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and remove ", under their direction." Section 510 and 511 are similarly amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer." Section 512 and 513 of Title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in various sentences. Section 514 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and to apply the provisions of subchapter V of chapter 35 of title 31 to resolve issues. Section 517 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the authority of the Joint Committee on Printing with that of the Public Printer. Additionally, sections 702 and 703 of title 44 are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer and the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate or the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, respectively. Section 707 of title 44, United States Code is amended to give the Public Printer the authority to print bills or resolutions in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, until final enactment in both Houses of Congress. Section 709 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in the second sentence. Section 714 is also amended to give the Public Printer the authority to establish rules in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 717 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with the Public Printer. Section 717, 718, and 721(a) of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 722 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing the direction of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 723 is also amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 724, 728, 738, and 901 of title 44, United States Code, are all amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 901, 902, and 903 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 905 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 906 is also amended to specify distribution of copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 905 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Distribution of copies is specified to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 1108 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to remove regulation by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1112 is also amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. Section 1112 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer." Sections 1121, 1301, 1320A, 1333, and 1338 of title 44 are also amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1338 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to remove limitations and conditions prescribed by the Joint Committee on Printing and replace it with the Public Printer. Section 1705 is also amended to remove regulation by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1710 is amended to remove a plan requirement. Section 1710 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to remove approval requirements by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1914 is also amended to eliminate approval by the Joint Committee on Printing. Additionally, Section 5(b) of the Federal Records Management Amendments of 1976 is amended to remove oversight by the Joint Committee on Printing. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the first day of the 9th month after enactment.
